block.p: An article in Business Day yesterday about plans by Bristol-Myers Squibb to sell some businesses and focus on prescription drugs referred incorrectly to an earnings projection made by Charles A. Heimbold Jr., the company's chairman, at a meeting with securities analysts and investors. He said the company's earnings per share would increase 14 percent this year, not 11 percent. The company expects earnings per share to increase 11 percent in 2001.

Heimbold Jr., the company's chairman, at a meeting with securities analysts and investors. He said the company's earnings per share would increase 14 percent this year, not 11 percent. The company expects earnings per share to increase 11 percent in 2001.
